thag2.2:5.2: but food doesn’t lead to peace of heart.
thag2.2:5.3: Seeing how this bag of bones is sustained by food,
thag2.2:6.1: They know it’s just a swamp,
thag2.2:6.2: this homage and veneration in respectable families.
thag2.2:6.3: Honor is a subtle dart, hard to extract,
thag2.2:6.4: and hard for a sinner to give up.
thag2.2:7.1: It was thus that these verses were recited by the senior venerable Piṇḍolabhāradvāja.
